member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window
member.summary: Provides an interface to expose Win32 HWND handles.
member.remarks:
This interface is implemented on objects that expose Win32 HWND handles. The resultant handle can be used with Win32 API calls.
Unlike the desktop .NET Framework this interface is not implemented in the base class. However you can implement it on any class which derives from or . The property can then be passed to native API functions such as those contained in the class.

example.code:
[VB] Imports OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms Imports OpenNETCF.Win32
Public Class MyControl Inherits System.Windows.Forms.Control Implements IWin32Window
Overridable ReadOnly Property Handle() As System.IntPtr Get Me.Capture = True Dim thishandle As IntPtr thishandle = Win32Window.GetCapture() Me.Capture = False
Handle = thishandle End Get End Property
End Class

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.GroupBox.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for the control.
member.value: A that represents the background color of the control.
member.remarks: This is an "ambient" property. In other words, if this property value is not explicitly set then the BackColor property value of the parent will be returned. If this property value is not explicitly set and the control does not have an associated parent, then the DefaultBackColor is returned.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.GroupBox.BorderStyle
member.summary: Indicates the border style for the control.
member.value: One of the values. The default is BorderStyle.FixedSingle.
member.remarks: On Windows CE devices where the intrinsic controls are rendered with a 3D look, the BorderStyle should be set to BorderStyle.Fixed3D. For Pocket PC, and similar operating systems where the user interface has a "flat" rendering, the BorderStyle should be set to BorderStyle.FixedSingle.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.StatusBarEx.StatusBarPanelCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the StatusBarPanel located at the specified index within the collection.
member.param: The zero-based index of the item to remove.
member.remarks: When you remove a panel from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent panels in the collection. All information about the removed panel is deleted. You can use this method to remove a specific panel from the list by specifying the index of the panel to remove from the collection. member.param: The amount by which to increment the progress bar's current position.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ProgressBarEx.PerformStep
member.summary: Advances the current position of the progress bar by the amount of the Step property
member.remarks:
The PerformStep method increments the value of the progress bar by the amount specified by the Step property. You can use the Step property to specify the amount that each completed task in an operation changes the value of the progress bar. For example, if you are copying a group of files, you might want to set the value of the Step property to 1 and the value of the Maximum property to the total number of files to copy. When each file is copied, you can call the PerformStep method to increment the progress bar by the value of the Step property. If you want to have more flexible control of the value of the progress bar, you can use the Increment method or set the value of the Value property directly.
The Value property specifies the current position of the ProgressBar. If, after calling the PerformStep method, the Value property is greater than the value of the Maximum property, the Value property remains at the value of the Maximum property. If, after calling the PerformStep method with a negative value specified in the value parameter, the Value property is less than the value of the Minimum property, the Value property remains at the value of the Minimum property.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.Clipboard
member.summary: Provides methods to place data on and retrieve data from the system clipboard.
member.remarks:
For a list of predefined formats to use with the Clipboard class, see the class.
Call to put data on the clipboard.
Place data on the clipboard in multiple formats to maximize the possibility that a target application, whose format requirements you might not know, can successfully retrieve the data.
Call to retrieve data from the clipboard. The data is returned as an object that implements the interface. Use the methods specified by and fields in to extract the data from the object. If you do not know the format of the data you retrieved, call the method of the interface to get a list of all formats that data is stored in. Then call the method of the interface, and specify a format that your application can use.
All Windows applications share the system clipboard, so the contents are subject to change when you switch to another application.. Supports only Unicode text and Image (Bitmap) formats.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX
member.summary:
Extended control styles.
New in v1.3

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.LEFT
member.summary: Creates a window that has generic "left-aligned" properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.MDICHILD
member.summary: Creates an MDI child window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.NOACTIVATE
member.summary: A top-level window created with this style cannot be activated. If a child window has this style, tapping it does not cause its top-level parent to be activated. A window that has this style receives stylus events, but neither it nor its child windows can get the focus. Supported in Windows CE versions 2.0 and later.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.NOANIMATION
member.summary: A window created with this style does not show animated exploding and imploding rectangles, and does not have a button on the taskbar. Supported in Windows CE versions 2.0 and later.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the CLIENTEDGE and WINDOWEDGE styles.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WINDOWEDGE, TOOLWINDOW, and TOPMOST styles.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window; that is, a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted. To achieve transparency without these restrictions, use the SetWindowRgn function.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS_EX.NONE
member.summary: Additional value for Completeness

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS
member.summary:
Window style flags.
New in v1.3

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.BORDER
member.summary: Creates a window that has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.CAPTION
member.summary: Creates a window that has a title bar (includes the BORDER style).

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.CHILD
member.summary: Creates a child window. This style cannot be used with the POPUP style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.CHILDWINDOW
member.summary: Same as the CHILD style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.DISABLED
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.DLGFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.GROUP
member.summary: Specifies the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.HSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.ICONIC
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the MINIMIZE style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially maximized.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Maximize button. Cannot be combined with the EX_CONTEXTHELP style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.MINIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the ICONIC style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Minimize button. Cannot be combined with the EX_CONTEXTHELP style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.OVERLAPPED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the TILED style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the OVERLAPPED, CAPTION, SYSMENU, THICKFRAME, MINIMIZEBOX, and MAXIMIZEBOX styles. Same as the TILEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.POPUP
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the CHILD style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window with BORDER, POPUP, and SYSMENU styles. The CAPTION and POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.SIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the THICKFRAME style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.SYSMENU
member.summary: Creates a window that has a Close (X) button in the non-client area.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.TABSTOP
member.summary: Specifies a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the TABSTOP style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.THICKFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.TILED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the OVERLAPPED style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.TILEDWINDOW
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window with the OVERLAPPED, CAPTION, SYSMENU, THICKFRAME, MINIMIZEBOX, and MAXIMIZEBOX styles. Same as the OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.VISIBLE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially visible.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.WS.VSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ButtonBase.IsSequentialPaintingComplete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the specified sequential painting token was the last one registered.
member.param: A that specifies the sequential painting token to compare with the last registered token.
member.returns: A that is set to True if the specified sequential painting token was the last one registered; otherwise, False.
member.remarks: A control can register for sequential painting by calling the RegisterSequentialPainting method.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ButtonBase.NotifyPaintingComplete(System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Indicates that a certain class (generation) in the control hierarchy has completed updating the presentation.
member.param: A that specifies the sequential painting token of the class (generation) that has completed updating the presentation.
A that references the original paint argument passed to the OnPaint method.
member.remarks: If the sequential painting token argument represents the last token registered, this method will raise the Paint event, using the double buffer object if the DoubleBufferEnabled property is set to True, and will also draw the contents of the buffer to the control, if applicable.

member.summary: Paints the background of the control.
member.param: A PaintEventArgs that contains information about the control to paint.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog
member.summary: Represents a common dialog box that displays available colors along with controls that allow the user to define custom colors.
member.remarks:
The inherited member must be invoked to create this specific common dialog box. Use to retrieve the color selected by the user.
When you create an instance of ColorDialog, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values. For a list of these values, see the ColorDialog constructor.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ColorDialog class.
member.remarks:
When you create an instance of ColorDialog, the following read/write properties are set to initial values. PropertyInitial Value
AllowFullOpentrue
ColorColor.Black
CustomColorsA null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)
FullOpenfalse
You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.Dispose
member.summary: Free up resources used by the ColorDialog

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.ShowDialog(OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Runs a common dialog box with the specified owner.
member.param: Any object that implements that represents the top-level window that will own the modal dialog box.
member.returns: DialogResult.OK if the user clicks OK in the dialog box; otherwise, DialogResult.Cancel.
member.remarks: This version of the ShowDialog method allows you to specify a specific form or control that will own the dialog box that is shown.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.ShowDialog
member.summary: Runs a common dialog box.
member.returns: DialogResult.OK if the user clicks OK in the dialog box; otherwise, DialogResult.Cancel.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.RunDialog(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specifies a common dialog box.
member.param: A value that represents the window handle of the owner window for the common dialog box.
member.returns: true if the dialog box was successfully run; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method is invoked when the user of a common dialog box calls .

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.AllowFullOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can use the dialog box to define custom colors.
member.value: true if the user can define custom colors; otherwise, false. The default is true
member.remarks: When set to false, the associated button in the dialog box is disabled and the user cannot access the custom colors control in the dialog box. Windows CE supports the button, Pocket PC does not and this property has no effect.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.AnyColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays all available colors in the set of basic colors.
member.value: true if the dialog box displays all available colors in the set of basic colors; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color selected by the user.
member.value: The color selected by the user. If a color is not selected, the default value is black.
member.remarks: The color selected by the user in the dialog box at run time, as defined in structure

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.CustomColors
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of custom colors shown in the dialog box.
member.value: A set of custom colors shown by the dialog box. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: Users can create their own set of custom colors. These colors are contained in an Int32 composed of the ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values necessary to create the color. For more information on the structure of this data, see . Custom colors can only be defined if is set to true (Not supported on Pocket PC).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.FullOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the controls used to create custom colors are visible when the dialog box is opened.
member.value: true if the custom color controls are available when the dialog box is opened; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
By default, the custom color controls are not visible when the dialog box is first opened. You must click the Custom Colors button to display them.
Note If is false, then FullOpen has no effect.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.ColorDialog.SolidColorOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box will restrict users to selecting solid colors only.

member.summary:
Instruct the WebBrowser to jump to the indicated anchor.
New in v1.3
member.param: The name of the anchor to which the HTML control is to jump.
member.remarks: If the anchor is already in the document, the jump occurs immediately. If the specified anchor is not in the document, the request will be remembered such that, if the anchor is added, the jump will occur as soon as the anchor is available. While there is a pending anchor, any navigation commands from the user, such as keyboard scrolling or using the scroll bar, aborts the pending anchor jump.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer
member.summary:
Controls playback of a sound from a .wav file.
New in v1.2

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class, attaches the .wav file within the specified .
New in v1.3

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class and attaches the specified .wav file.
New in v1.2
member.param: The location of a .wav file to load.
member.remarks: The string passed to the soundLocation parameter must be a path to a .wav file. If the path is invalid, the object will still be constructed, but subsequent calls to a load or play method will fail.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.Play
member.summary:
Plays the .wav file using a new thread.
New in v1.2
member.remarks: The Play method plays the sound using a new thread. If the .wav file has not been specified or it fails to load, the Play method will play the default beep sound.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.PlaySync
member.summary:
Plays the .wav file using the UI thread.
New in v1.2
member.remarks: The PlaySync method uses the current thread to play a .wav file, preventing the thread from handling other messages until the load is complete. After a .wav file is successfully loaded from a Stream or URL path, future calls to playback methods for the SoundPlayer object will not need to reload the .wav file until the path for the sound changes. If the .wav file has not been specified or it fails to load, the PlaySync method will play the default beep sound.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.PlayLooping
member.summary:
Plays and loops the .wav file using a new thread and loads the .wav file first if it has not been loaded.
New in v1.2
member.remarks: The PlayLooping method plays and loops the sound using a new thread. If the .wav file has not been specified or it fails to load, the PlayLooping method will play the default beep sound.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.Stop
member.summary:
Stops playback of the sound if playback is occurring.
New in v1.2

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.SoundLocation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the file path of the .wav file to load.
New in v1.2
member.value: The file path from which to load a .wav file, or if no file path is present. The default is .

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.SoundPlayer.Stream
member.summary:
Gets or sets the from which to load the .wav file.
New in v1.3
member.remarks: This property is set to null when the property is set to a new and valid sound location.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.IMessageFilter
member.summary: Defines a message filter interface.
member.remarks:
This interface allows an application to capture a message before it is dispatched to a control or form.
A class that implements the IMessageFilter interface can be added to the application's message pump to filter out a message or perform other operations before the message is dispatched to a form or control. To add the message filter to an application's message pump, use the method in the class.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.IMessageFilter.PreFilterMessage(OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Filters out a message before it is dispatched.
member.param: The message to be dispatched. You cannot modify this message.
member.returns: true to filter the message and stop it from being dispatched; false to allow the message to continue to the next filter or control.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon
member.summary: Specifies a component that creates an icon in the status area
member.remarks: Icons in the status area are short cuts to processes that are running in the background of a computer, such as a virus protection program or a volume control. These processes do not come with their own user interfaces. The class provides a way to program in this functionality. The Icon property defines the icon that appears in the status area. Pop-up menus for an icon are addressed with the ContextMenu property. The property assigns ToolTip text (Tooltips are not supported by the Pocket PC interface). In order for the icon to show up in the status area, the property must be set to true.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NotifyIcon class.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon.IconHandle
member.summary:
Get or set the native Icon handle used to display the NotifyIcon.
New in v1.3
member.remarks: Ensure that the value you set to this property is a valid HIcon. By default the applications icon is assigned to the NotifyIcon control.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the ToolTip text displayed when the mouse hovers over a status area icon.
member.remarks: The Pocket PC interface does not display tooptips.
member.value: The ToolTip text displayed when the mouse hovers over a status area icon.
member.exception: ToolTip text must be less than 64 characters long.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Windows.Forms.NotifyIcon.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the icon is visible in the status notification area of the taskbar.
member.value: true if the icon is visible in the status area; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Since the default value is false, in order for the icon to show up in the status area, you must set the Visible property to true.
